pr_title: GEODE-8166: reimplement redis expiration to use new data model

timeline.message:
refactored the delta code for RedisHash and RedisSet into AbstractRedisData

added timestamp field to RedisData and implemented serialization and delta for it

active expiration now implemented

implemented passive expiration

Adds test for passive expiration

RedisStringInRegion will now do active expiration
RedisKeyInRegion no longer needed the RegionProvider

fixed expiration on String commands
renabld some ignored expiration tests
removed the old expiration code
passive expiration now uses the correct hasExpired method
decr now uses a function and is atomic

getset now uses a function and is atomic
fixed an issue with the set commands doing expiration that caused them to do an extra network roundtrip
fixed some of the exception messages for numerics
decrby and incrby now use functions and are atomic

timeline.bodyText: Is there a resion why we're calling expire separately instead of using a set option?
timeline.author: ringles

replies.bodyText: early on this branch, the new expiration was only working on sets and hashes. So I changed these tests to use sets instead of strings. It seems like this test is okay with any data type so I left it using a set.
replies.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason for switching from string values to Sets?
timeline.author: ringles

replies.bodyText: early on this branch, the new expiration was only working on sets and hashes. So I changed these tests to use sets instead of strings. It seems like this test is okay with any data type so I left it using a set.
replies.author: dschneider-pivotal

timeline.bodyText: To check my understanding - the jedis.keys() command will just get the keyset, but since it doesn't get the values of the keys it doesn't trigger the active expiration. Right?
timeline.author: ringles
